aquarium.hw

Class TestTemperatureSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • aquarium.hw.TestTemperatureSensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TemperatureSensor, Observable

    public class TestTemperatureSensor
extends java.lang.Object
implements TemperatureSensor

    The TestTemperatureSensor allows testing of an aquarium control that requires a temperature sensor and a temperature adjuster. It allows the test code to simulate changes in temperature by calling setTemperature(). This can be done directly by the test case code or from the TestTemperatureAdapter.

    The TestTemperatureSensor works in collaboration with the TestTemperatureAdapter.

    Version:
    Jul 28, 2016

      • setDelta

        public void setDelta(double delta)
        Description copied from interface: TemperatureSensor
        Set the delta for the sensor to the specified delta. This will cause the sensor to notify observers when the absolute value of the difference between the current temperature and the last reported temperature is greater than or equal to the delta.
        Specified by:
        setDelta in interface TemperatureSensor
        Parameters:
        delta - the new delta

      • setTemperature

        public void setTemperature(double temp)

      • getTemperature

        public double getTemperature()
        Description copied from interface: TemperatureSensor
        A getter for the temperature. The normal way of obtaining the temperature is through notifications by giving the sensor an observer. This is an alternate way to get a single snapshot of the current temperature.
        Specified by:
        getTemperature in interface TemperatureSensor
        Returns:
        the current temperature from the sensor
